pullRequest.body:
We also  `summable_partition` (and the required  `Set.sigmaEquiv`), needed for #10377.

Ignore the typo in the PR name!

nodes.body: OK I split this into two PRs. The code moving is now #12503. Once that goes in this will only have the two new results.

Again, the `no_lost_declarations` script reports

* `+` `lemma summable_partition {Œ∫ Œπ: Type*} {f : Œπ ‚Üí ‚Ñù} (hf : 0 ‚â§ f) {s : Œ∫ ‚Üí Set Œπ}`

---

* 1  added declarations
* 0  removed declarations
* 9  paired declarations

---
This needs a rebase now #12503 is in, please feel free to ping me for a review once you've merged master

LGTM, thanks!

This is very small and I think we can just merge it, but if you start using partition a lot (meaning `(s : Œ∫ ‚Üí Set Œπ) (hs : ‚àÄ i, ‚àÉ! j, i ‚àà s j`) we probably want a small API, but we will see. Thanks!

bors merge

> This is very small and I think we can just merge it, but if you start using partition a lot (meaning `(s : Œ∫ ‚Üí Set Œπ) (hs : ‚àÄ i, ‚àÉ! j, i ‚àà s j`) we probably want a small API, but we will see. Thanks!
> 

Yeah I don't know how much it'll be used for example for the stuff Yael wanted the Finest.box for. But yes we can add more API if needed.

Pull request successfully merged into master.

Build succeeded:
  * [Build](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/8936310225/job/24546389707)
  * [Check all files imported](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/8936310225/job/24546389253)
  * [Lint style](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/8936310225/job/24546389488)

I can confirm that this PR is almost only code motion, replacing a proof by a commented more elegant version and two new declarations.

This PR would be easier to review if you split the move from the new code: I approve the code motion/porting TODO parts (but didn't scrutinize the others carefully).

I can confirm that this PR is almost only code motion, replacing a proof by a commented more elegant version and two new declarations.

This PR would be easier to review if you split the move from the new code: I approve the code motion/porting TODO parts (but didn't scrutinize the others carefully).
For future reviewers: this is the only new lemma (`sigmaEquiv` is also new, of course); all others are just moved/that porting TODO.
Pre-existing: I would put a full stop at the end of each comment, as these are complete sentences.

The naming is quite inconsistent here: the target type is called `Œ≤` in the docstring, but is `Œπ` in the code, and a generic element of it is called `x` (which is also used for a generic element of the source sigma type). Also, I find it disturbing that the "index" type is not the one called `Œπ`! What do you think of the following equivalent version?
```suggestion
/-- Equivalence from the disjoint union of a family of sets forming a partition of `Œ≤`, to `Œ≤` 
itself. -/
noncomputable def sigmaEquiv (s : Œ± ‚Üí Set Œ≤) (hs : ‚àÄ b, ‚àÉ! i, b ‚àà s i) :
    (Œ£ i, s i) ‚âÉ Œ≤ where
  toFun | ‚ü®_, b‚ü© => b
  invFun b := ‚ü®(hs b).choose, b, (hs b).choose_spec.1‚ü©
  left_inv | ‚ü®i, b, hb‚ü© => Sigma.subtype_ext ((hs b).choose_spec.2 i hb).symm rfl
  right_inv _ := rfl
```
Here I've used the Lean4 pattern-match syntax to unpack the variables at the point they're introduced.
Yes thank you, this def/lemma went through lots of versions and I forgot to make the description and the notation better!

```suggestion
  simpa only [‚Üê (Set.sigmaEquiv s hs).summable_iff] using summable_sigma_of_nonneg (fun _ ‚Ü¶ hf _)
```

```suggestion
lemma summable_partition {Œ∫ Œπ : Type*} {f : Œπ ‚Üí ‚Ñù} (hf : 0 ‚â§ f) {s : Œ∫ ‚Üí Set Œπ}
```
(Maybe also rename the types consistently with the above lemma)

**[lint-style]** reported by [reviewdog](https://github.com/reviewdog/reviewdog) :dog:
```suggestion /-- Equivalence from the disjoint union of a family of sets forming a partition of `Œ≤`, to `Œ≤` ```
